text:
HPI: 50M with a fib noncompliant on coumadin, CAD s/p stent x6, CHF
   with diastolic dysfunction, HTN, morbid obesity, alcoholism, and DM tx
   from [**Hospital6 3044**] for poss intervention following CVA.
   Patient presented on [**11-19**] with 2d of general malaise, abd pain, one
   bout of emesis, near syncope during micturition as well as tinnitus. He
   was noted to be hypotensive upon arrival to the ED, which resolved
   following fluid boluses. Head CT showed likely old parietal infarct and
   possible area of low attenuation in the central pons (?infarct). CT
   abd/chest no evidence of aortic dissection. On presentation his INR was
   1.0, PT 10.5s and PTT 26.1s. 11:35am [**11-19**] transient slurring of
   speech, with normal upper and lower extremity strength, tone,
   and sensation bilaterally. 18:00 his speech was still slurred with
   decreased LUE and LLE strength ([**5-29**] -> [**4-29**]). At 20:00 he began to have
   an expressive language difficulty along with his slurred speech, with
   right facial drooping, he also had a poor cough and difficulty clearing
   his secretions. MRI/MRA head/neck [**11-19**] showed possible basilar artery
   thrombosis with multiple infarcts in the brainstem and cerebellar
   hemispheres. He was note to have absent gag later in morning and he was
   intubated prior to arrival in ICU for airway protection.
   Fever (Hyperthermia, Pyrexia, not Fever of Unknown Origin)
   Assessment:
   Temp 102.5 max
   BAL gm+cocci and gm-rods
   Action:
   No cultures per SICU resident
   Tylenol and cooling
   Frequent suction
   Tube feeds held at MN and heparin gtt stopped @2am
   Response:
   Temp improved
   Plan:
   Ongoing, continue ABX and Tylenol
   Will still plan PEG today
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 11**])
   Assessment:
   Saturations 92-96% one episode of drop to 88%
   Action:
   Peep increased to 8 and FIO2 increased to 60%
   Response:
   copious amts of secretions persist
   Plan:
   trach collar for short sprints
